title: A note on congruences for generalized cubic partitions modulo primes
abstract:
Recently, Amdeberhan, Sellers and Singh introduced the notion of a
generalized cubic partition function $a_c(n)$ and proved two isolated
congruences via modular forms, namely $a_3(7n+4)\equiv 0\pmod{7}$ and
$a_5(11n+10)\equiv 0\pmod{11}$. In this paper, we provide another proofs of
these congruences using classical $q$-series manipulations. We also give an
infinite family of congruences for $a_c(n)$ for primes $p\equiv 5,7\pmod{8}$
and other isolated congruences modulo $19,23$ and $31$ using modular forms.
